snippet.textDisplay:
Well Star Ocean 3 has many different twist and characters. For example 
You can sometimes choose to gain a new ally or turn them down to maybe get a different ally. There are 5 optional   characters you can keep, or turn away .Names:
Nel,Albel,Roger,Adray. and Peppita
snippet.textOriginal:

Nel,Albel,Roger,Adray. and Peppita

snippet.textDisplay: I liked this game less as I went on, but I liked a lot of the characters, and the amount of focus and detail that went into the planets (rather than just having "ice planet" and "city planet"), even if you only went to a few of them. Peppita was my favorite character to play as; her icicle spears were so broken that it was great.
snippet.textOriginal: I liked this game less as I went on, but I liked a lot of the characters, and the amount of focus and detail that went into the planets (rather than just having "ice planet" and "city planet"), even if you only went to a few of them. Peppita was my favorite character to play as; her icicle spears were so broken that it was great.

Hey SupraDarky. I'm currently writing my B.A.-Thesis about the game Okami. Particularly this playlist is really helping me to achieve a balance between delicious Game-Music and relaxing tunes. Thank you for your great work and keep it up!
(Greetings from Germany! Come by if you ever visit it!)
snippet.textOriginal:
Hey SupraDarky. I'm currently writing my B.A.-Thesis about the game Okami. Particularly this playlist is really helping me to achieve a balance between delicious Game-Music and relaxing tunes. Thank you for your great work and keep it up!

snippet.textDisplay: One of my favorite tracks from a video game. Star Ocean Till The End of Time for Playstation 2. I remember playing this at the end of Autumn, the crisp air was cozy, the warmth of my apartment, and then playing this game/track echoing through the room... always brings me back to that moment... nostalgic chill bumps everywhere.
snippet.textOriginal: One of my favorite tracks from a video game. Star Ocean Till The End of Time for Playstation 2. I remember playing this at the end of Autumn, the crisp air was cozy, the warmth of my apartment, and then playing this game/track echoing through the room... always brings me back to that moment... nostalgic chill bumps everywhere.

snippet.textDisplay:
I know that feeling.  The Desolate Smell of Earth and the castle theme from Super Mario 64 have both also done that to me @_@

But, video game music and sounds is such a common part of my life, putting a runthrough of a game on my laptop [usually of something 'quieter' like Donkey Kong Country] has become a great way to lull myself to sleep.  @_@
snippet.textOriginal:
I know that feeling.  The Desolate Smell of Earth and the castle theme from Super Mario 64 have both also done that to me @_@
